sen.j: 越前守、五位蔵人、近江介・右近中将などを歴任、大治5年（1130年）10月に崇徳天皇の蔵人頭に補任され、翌年の天承元年（1131年）参議となり、以後累進して永暦2年（1161年）に内大臣に至る。
sen.e: He filled successively the posts of Echizen no kuni no kami (Governor of Echizen Province), Goi no kurodo (Kurodo with the fifth rank), Omi no suke (Assistant governor of Omi Province) and Deputy General of Imperial Guard of the Right and so on, and in October 1130, he was appointed to Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and the next year in 1131, he became a Sangi (councilor) and after that the promotion continued to the post of Naidaijin (the Minister of the center) in 1161.

sen.j: 議政官として中宮（藤原聖子）権大夫・右兵衛督・右衛門督・検非違使別当・皇太后宮（藤原聖子）大夫などを兼帯した。
sen.e: As a Giseikan (Legislature), he held the posts of Chugu (FUJIWARA no Seishi) Gon no daibu (Provisional master of the Consort's Household), Uhyoe no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Middle Palace Guards), Uemon no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Outer Palace Guards), Kebiishi no betto (Superintendent of the Imperial Police), and Kotaigo gu (FUJIWARA no Seishi) no daibu (Master of the Empress Dowager's Household) and so on at the same time.

sen.e: Meantime, in 1156 when he was at the post of Gon Dainagon (Provisional major counselor), he reported to the Cloistered Emperor Toba who was very seriously ill that they should have been prepared to the expected disturbance after the demise of Toba (in the entry of "Gukansho.")
